sect2.title: fixedAsset, sme:pluralName=fixedAssets, sme:compliance=MUST, sme:canGet=TRUE, sme:canPut=TRUE, sme:canPost=TRUE, sme:canDelete=TRUE, sme:isSyncSource=TRUE, sme:isSyncTarget=TRUE

entry.para: Flag to indicate if the Fixed Asset is an ‘active’ one .
Flag to indicate if Fixed Asset is (soft) deleted.
The label for the resource to be presented in the user interface. To support application-specific or language-specific descriptions of resources.
Identifier of the Fixed Asset group this Fixed Asset belongs to.
FixedAssets can only belong to one FixedAsset Group of type “Family”, but may belong to many groups of type “user defined”.
reference for the Fixed Asset (typically the one used by the buying organization).
Another reference for the Fixed Asset.
Link to the OperatingCompany associated with the Fixed Asset.
Link to the Workplace (within the Operating Company) associated with the Fixed Asset
Status of ownership for the Fixed Asset (planned – also known as expenditure - or actual).
A link to the (depreciation) schedule associated with the Fixed Asset.
An asset may be on more than one schedule as there may be one for tax and one for accounting.
A shorter name for the Fixed Asset.
The Fixed Asset holding terms (clarifies ownership terms around the asset)
For holding terms that are either leasing contract, or concession, there may be an associated contract – this is the contract reference.
The asset type associated with the Fixed Asset.
Flag to indicate the permanence (or otherwise) of the Fixed Asset.
reference for the Fixed Asset in a Supplier catalogue.
Link to the Fixed Asset Supplier trading account.
reference for the Fixed Asset as used by the Supplier.
Link to the Company associated with manufacturing the Fixed Asset.
reference for the Fixed Asset as used by the manufacturer.
Tax codes governing the legal tax applicable to this Fixed Asset (e.g. VAT, GST).
Flag to indicate if legal tax (VAT, GST) is recoverable on the Fixed Asset.
Tax codes governing what legal tax is recoverable (if legal tax recovery flag = recoverable)
Tax codes governing the IAS tax applicable to this Fixed Asset (e.g. VAT, GST).
Flag to indicate if IAS tax (VAT, GST) is recoverable on the Fixed Asset.
Tax codes governing what IAS tax is recoverable (if IAS tax recovery flag = recoverable)
Link to the legal Financial Account Group associated with this Fixed Asset.
Legal financial accounting code applicable to the Fixed Asset.
Link to the IAS Financial Account Group associated with this Fixed Asset.
IAS financial accounting code applicable to the Fixed Asset.
The GTIN (global trade identification number) for the Fixed Asset (e.g. EAN-13, UPC-13 for barcodes).
If this Fixed Asset has been superseded this is a link to the ‘new’ Fixed Asset.
For superceded or replaced Fixed Assets, this is the start date of the replacement.
The currency of the Fixed Asset (e.g. GBP, USD, EUR).
The currency as used by OperatingCompany, the business operating the Sage application (the “base” currency).
Rate used to convert from Fixed Asset Currency into Fixed Asset OperatingCompany Currency, if different.
FixedAsset OperatingCompany Currency Exchange Rate Operator
Operator to be used (multiplication or division) to convert from Fixed Asset Currency to Fixed Asset OperatingCompany Currency.

E.g. if the operator is division then it is Sales Order Values in Sales Order Currency / Sales Order Operating Company Currency Exchange Rate = Sales Order Values in Sales Order OperatingCompany currency.
FixedAsset OperatingCompany Currency Exchange Rate Date
Date of the exchange rate used to convert from Fixed Asset Currency to Fixed Asset OperatingCompany Currency, if different.
Depending on the costing method used, this is the “cost” of the Fixed Asset.
Depending on the costing method used, this is the “cost” of the Fixed Asset.
The legal nature of the Fixed Asset
The IAS nature of the Fixed Asset
Purchase Requisition Line(s) associated with the Fixed Asset.
Purchase Order Line(s) associated with the Fixed Asset.
Purchase Order Delivery Line(s) associated with the Fixed Asset.
Purchase Invoice Line(s) associated with the Fixed Asset.
Purchase Return Line(s) associated with the Fixed Asset.
Purchase Return Delivery Line(s) associated with the Fixed Asset.
Purchase Credit Line(s) associated with the Fixed Asset.
Flag to indicate if Fixed Asset is created from Commodities (see below).
A link to the associated Commodity that created the Fixed Asset. Commodities are products/items that can be bought that can be turned into Fixed Assets.
For Fixed Assets that are leased, this is a link to the lease.
For Fixed Assets that have a grant associated with them, this is a link to the grant.
Project associated with the Fixed Asset.
A link to the associated unit of measure for the Fixed Asset. Units of measure cover each, pack sizes, etc.
The quantity of the Fixed Asset.
Link to Child Fixed Asset associated with this Fixed Asset.
FixedAssets can be ‘nested’ to create FixedAsset hierarchies.
Link to Parent Fixed Asset associated with this Fixed Asset.
FixedAssets can be ‘nested’ to create FixedAsset hierarchies.
The cash generating unit associated with the Fixed Asset (IAS).
The business unit associated with the Fixed Asset (IAS).
The geographical unit associated with the Fixed Asset (IAS).
Date the Fixed Asset was last transferred.
The type of acquisition (if applicable) that resulted in the Fixed Asset becoming part of the Operating Company.
If the Fixed Asset was via an acquisition, then this is the acquisition date.
The date the Fixed Asset was posted to the system (may be different from acquisition date).
Date the Fixed Asset was put into operation (service).
For Fixed Assets that are of acquisition type = Purchase, this is the type of purchase that was made.
For Fixed Assets that are of acquisition type = Purchase, this is the date that the purchase was made.
Date the Fixed Asset was last serviced.
Flag to indicate if the Fixed Asset is available for sale.
For Fixed Assets that are made available for sale, this is the date they were made available for sale.
Date the Fixed Asset was sold (if applicable).
Flag to indicate the business use unit applicable to the Fixed Asset (percent or amount or unit)

The value of the Fixed Asset used for business use, expressed in business use rate type, e.g. 100 percent used for business, 50 units used for business, etc. The proportion not used for business is normally associated with private/personal use.
A link to all of the Fixed Asset Events associated with the Fixed Asset.
A link to the Employee associated with the Fixed Asset
A link to the human resource Benefit that this Fixed Asset may be for (e.g. could be a labtop loan).
Notes associated with a Fixed Asset.

sect2.title: fixedAssetGroup, sme:pluralName=fixedAssetGroups, sme:compliance=MAY, sme:canGet=TRUE, sme:canPut=TRUE, sme:canPost=TRUE, sme:canDelete=TRUE, sme:isSyncSource=TRUE, sme:isSyncTarget=TRUE

entry.para: The Fixed Asset Group unique identifier.
Flag to indicate if the Fixed Asset Group is an ‘active’ one .
Flag to indicate if Fixed Asset Group is (soft) deleted.
The label for the resource to be presented in the user interface. To support application-specific or language-specific descriptions of resources.
reference for the Fixed Asset Group.
Another reference for the Fixed Asset Group.
Link to the OperatingCompany associated with the Fixed Asset Group.
The type of Fixed Asset Group (Asset Family or User defined). Typically a Fixed Asset will belong to 1 Asset Family, but may belong to many user-defiend groups).
Name of the Fixed Asset Group.
If this does not exist then a dummy entry should be created, e.g. “MAS500 Fixed Assets”
A longer description of the Fixed Asset Group.
Fixed Assets associated with the FixedAsset Group.
FixedAssets can belong to multiple FixedAsset Groups.
Notes associated with a Fixed Asset Group.

sect2.title: fixedAssetSchedule, sme:pluralName=fixedAssetSchedules, sme:compliance=SHOULD, sme:canGet=TRUE, sme:canPut=TRUE, sme:canPost=TRUE, sme:canDelete=TRUE, sme:isSyncSource=TRUE, sme:isSyncTarget=TRUE

entry.para: The Fixed Asset Schedule unique identifier.
Flag to indicate if the Fixed Asset Schedule is an ‘active’ one .
Flag to indicate if Fixed Asset Schedule is (soft) deleted.
The label for the resource to be presented in the user interface. To support application-specific or language-specific descriptions of resources.
Reference associated with the Fixed Asset Schedule.
Another reference associated with the Fixed Asset Schedule.
Link to the OperatingCompany associated with the Fixed Asset Schedule.
Name of the Fixed Asset Schedule.
A link to the Fixed Asset(s) associated with the schedule.
Textual description of the Fixed Asset Schedule.
The type of Fixed Asset Schedule (plan type for example).
The type of accounting used by the Fixed Asset Schedule, e.g. GAAP, IFRS, other
Status of the Fixed Asset Schedule.
The Actual/planned duration of the Fixed Asset Schedule, in duration unit.
Year associate with the Fixed Asset Schedule (where a schedule spans multiple years there will be multiple fixed asset schedules)
Period associate with the Fixed Asset Schedule
Flag to indicate if this Fixed Asset Schedule is the current on.
The date the Fixed Asset Schedule started.
The date (actual/planned) the Fixed Asset Schedule finished.
The current date of the Fixed Asset Schedule.
A link to a previous Fixed Asset Schedule that this schedule is related to (e.g. for multiple years, this will point to the schedule for the previous year).
Link to Child Fixed Asset Schedule associated with this Fixed Asset Schedule.
FixedAssetSchedules can be ‘nested’ to create FixedAssetSchedule hierarchies (e.g. a parent schedule could be for a year, whereas the child schedules could be for periods).
Link to Parent Fixed Asset Schedule associated with this Fixed Asset Schedule.
FixedAssetSchedules can be ‘nested’ to create FixedAssetSchedule hierarchies (e.g. a parent schedule could be for a year, whereas the child schedules could be for periods).
The primary method used for depreciation on the Fixed Asset Schedule.
The secondary method used for depreciation on the Fixed Asset Schedule – could be country, asset or time specific.

A primary method must be provided. The secondary method is used to further clarify the primary method – e.g. if the primary method is “user defined” then this method would describe the user definition.
The currency of the Fixed Asset Schedule (e.g. GBP, USD, EUR).
The currency as used by OperatingCompany, the business operating the Sage application (the “base” currency).
Rate used to convert from Fixed Asset Schedule Currency into Fixed Asset Schedule OperatingCompany Currency, if different.
FixedAssetSchedule OperatingCompany Currency Exchange Rate Operator
Operator to be used (multiplication or division) to convert from Fixed Asset Schedule Currency to Fixed Asset Schedule OperatingCompany Currency.

E.g. if the operator is division then it is Sales Order Values in Sales Order Currency / Sales Order Operating Company Currency Exchange Rate = Sales Order Values in Sales Order OperatingCompany currency.
FixedAssetSchedule OperatingCompany Currency Exchange Rate Date
Date of the exchange rate used to convert from Fixed Asset Schedule Currency to Fixed Asset Schedule OperatingCompany Currency, if different.
Flag to indicate the type of depreciation rate applicable to the Fixed Asset Schedule (percent or amount)
Deprecitation applicable to the Fixed Asset Schedule expressed as an amount (e.g. gross amount).
Deprecitation applicable to the Fixed Asset Schedule expressed as a percent (e.g. of the current book value).
Deprecitation applicable to the Fixed Asset Schedule expressed as a unit.
The book value of the Fixed Asset associated with the Fixed Asset Schedule as at the start of the schedule (e.g. start of year).
The current book value of the Fixed Asset associated with the Fixed Asset Schedule.
The book value of the Fixed Asset associated with the Fixed Asset Schedule as at the end of the schedule (e.g. end of year).
The depreciable value of the Fixed Asset associated with the Fixed Asset Schedule as at the start of the schedule (e.g. start of year).
The current depreciable value of the Fixed Asset associated with the Fixed Asset Schedule.
The depreciable value of the Fixed Asset associated with the Fixed Asset Schedule as at the end of the schedule (e.g. end of year).
The Market value of the Fixed Asset associated with the Fixed Asset Schedule as at the start of the schedule (e.g. start of year).
The current Market value of the Fixed Asset associated with the Fixed Asset Schedule.
The Market value of the Fixed Asset associated with the Fixed Asset Schedule as at the end of the schedule (e.g. end of year).
The Scrap value of the Fixed Asset associated with the Fixed Asset Schedule as at the start of the schedule (e.g. start of year).
The current Scrap value of the Fixed Asset associated with the Fixed Asset Schedule.
The Scrap value of the Fixed Asset associated with the Fixed Asset Schedule as at the end of the schedule (e.g. end of year).
The Impairment value of the Fixed Asset associated with the Fixed Asset Schedule as at the start of the schedule (e.g. start of year).
The Impairment value of the Fixed Asset associated with the Fixed Asset Schedule for the current schedule (e.g. year).
The value of any Impairment reversals for the Fixed Asset associated with the Fixed Asset Schedule for the current schedule (e.g. year).
The Impairment value of the Fixed Asset associated with the Fixed Asset Schedule as at the end of the schedule (e.g. end of year).
This will usually be start value + current value – reversal value.
The Revaluation value of the Fixed Asset associated with the Fixed Asset Schedule as at the start of the schedule (e.g. start of year).
The revaluation value of the Fixed Asset associated with the Fixed Asset Schedule for the current schedule (e.g. year).
The value of any Revaluation reversals for the Fixed Asset associated with the Fixed Asset Schedule for the current schedule (e.g. year).
The Revaluation value of the Fixed Asset associated with the Fixed Asset Schedule as at the end of the schedule (e.g. end of year).
This will usually be start value + current value – reversal value.
The amount of any surplus caused by revaluation (e.g. where asset is revalue above its previous valuation).
The cumulative value of the depreciation amount financial expense (charge).
Last exception depreciation amount financial expense (charge).
The cumulative value of the exception depreciation amount financial expense (charge).
Derogatory depreciation amount financial expense (charge) – typically depreciation expense (tax) – depreciation expense (accounting)..
Derogatory depreciation amount financial expense (charge) reversal value – typically depreciation expense (tax) – depreciation expense (accounting)..
Textual information associated with the Fixed Asset Schedule.
Textual information associated with the Fixed Asset Schedule.
Financial accounting code applicable to the Fixed Asset Schedule (e.g. depreciation cost account).
A link to all of the Fixed Asset Events associated with the Fixed Asset Schedule.
Notes associated with the Fixed Asset Schedule

sect2.title: fixedAssetEvent, sme:pluralName=fixedAssetEvents, sme:compliance=SHOULD, sme:canGet=TRUE, sme:canPut=TRUE, sme:canPost=TRUE, sme:canDelete=TRUE, sme:isSyncSource=TRUE, sme:isSyncTarget=TRUE

entry.para: The Fixed Asset Event unique identifier.
Flag to indicate if the Fixed Asset Event is an ‘active’ one .
Flag to indicate if Fixed Asset Event is (soft) deleted.
The label for the resource to be presented in the user interface. To support application-specific or language-specific descriptions of resources.
reference for the Fixed Asset Event.
Additional reference for the Fixed Asset Event.
Name of the Fixed Asset Event.
Link to the OperatingCompany associated with the Fixed Asset Event.
Link to any other OperatingCompany associated with the Fixed Asset Event e.g. when an Asset is transferred from one company to another this will typically be the receiving Operating Company.
Status of the Fixed Asset Event (e.g. approved, etc).
Flag to indicate if the Fixed Asset Event is for a Fixed Asset or a Lease.
A link to the Fixed Asset associated with the event.
A link to the (depreciation) schedule associated with (and used to generate) the Fixed Asset Event.
For Fixed Assets that are leased, this is a link to the lease.
For Fixed Assets that have a grant associated with them, this is a link to the grant.

Any sub-Type associated with the Fixed Asset Event (e.g. a “Fixed Asset Disposal”-type event may have a disposal type associated with it. This may also be an application specific description of the event, e.g. IML, for X3 Impairment on Fixed Asset Deletion (Cancellation)).
Date the Fixed Asset Event was raised.
Used to indicate the point at which the Fixed Asset Event is accounted for.
Used to indicate the point at which the Fixed Asset Event was posted (e.g. depreciation charge).
The currency (e.g. GBP, USD, EUR) used on the Fixed Asset Event.
The currency as used by OperatingCompany, the business operating the Sage application (the “base” currency).
Rate used to convert from Fixed Asset Event Currency into Fixed Asset Event OperatingCompany Currency, if different.
FixedAssetEvent OperatingCompany Currency Exchange Rate Operator
Operator to be used (multiplication or division) to convert from Fixed Asset Event Currency to Fixed Asset Event OperatingCompany Currency.

E.g. if the operator is division then it is Fixed Asset Event Values in Fixed Asset Event Currency / Fixed Asset Event Operating Company Currency Exchange Rate = Fixed Asset Event Values in Fixed Asset Event OperatingCompany currency.
FixedAssetEvent OperatingCompany Currency Exchange Rate Date
Date of the exchange rate used to convert from Fixed Asset Event Currency to Fixed Asset Event OperatingCompany Currency, if different.
Link to the user who the Fixed Asset Event is for.
The ‘user’ resource will be defined in the future.
Reference to another document that created the Fixed Asset Event (e.g. the purchase order or Invoice).
Reference to a lineanother document that created the Fixed Asset Event (e.g. the purchase order line or Invoice line).
Flag to indicate the unit used to proportion the asset applicable to the Fixed Asset Event (percent or amount or unit) – used where events are ‘partial’ events e.g. effect 50 percent of asset.

The value (proportion) of the Fixed Asset applicable to the Fixed Asset Event, expressed in proportion unit, e.g. 50 percent, 50 units, 1000 amount, etc. Used where events are ‘partial’ i.e. not effecting the full asset.
The amount of the Fixed Asset Event (e.g. Transfer value, Sale value, Purchase value).
The tax amount of the Fixed Asset Event (e.g. any tax/VAT on a disposal).
The invoice tax amount of the Fixed Asset Event (e.g. any tax/VAT on a sale).
The recovered tax amount of the Fixed Asset Event (e.g. not all tax/VAT on a sale may be recoverable).
The tax reduction amount of the Fixed Asset Event.
The tax amount reversal of the Fixed Asset Event (e.g. any tax/VAT reversal on a disposal or cancellation).
The value of any sale proceeds associated with the Fixed Asset Event of type “Fixed Asset Sale” only.
The value of any other proceeds associated with the Fixed Asset Event.
The value of any gain or loss on the Fixed Asset Event.
The value of any deferred gain or loss on the Fixed Asset Event.
The value of any expenses associated with the Fixed Asset Event e.g. cost of sale, cost of transfer, disposal costs, etc.
The book value (new amount) of the Fixed Asset following the completion of the Fixed Asset Event. (e.g. end of period/year).
The prior book value (old amount) of the Fixed Asset following the completion of the Fixed Asset Event. (e.g. end of period/year).
Text/commentary (e.g. special Delivery instructions) for the Fixed Asset Event
Text/commentary (e.g. special Delivery instructions) for the Fixed Asset Event
The balance sheet value (new amount) – following revaluation – of the Fixed Asset following the completion of the Fixed Asset Event.
FixedAssetEvent Prior Revaluated Balance Sheet Value
The balance sheet value (old/prior amount) – following revaluation – of the Fixed Asset following the completion of the Fixed Asset Event.
The variance value – following revaluation – of the Fixed Asset following the completion of the Fixed Asset Event.
The reversal value – following revaluation – of the Fixed Asset following the completion of the Fixed Asset Event.
The current (e.g. period/year) depreciation amount associated with the Fixed Asset following the completion of the Fixed Asset Event.
The current (e.g. period/year) depreciation reversal amount associated with the Fixed Asset following the completion of the Fixed Asset Event.
The posted depreciation amount associated with the Fixed Asset following the completion of the Fixed Asset Event.
The accumulated posted depreciation amount associated with the Fixed Asset following the completion of the Fixed Asset Event.
The financial year posted depreciation amount associated with the Fixed Asset following the completion of the Fixed Asset Event.
FixedAssetEvent Prior Financial Year Posted Depreciation
The prior financial year posted depreciation amount associated with the Fixed Asset following the completion of the Fixed Asset Event.
FixedAssetEvent Prior Financial Year Posted Depreciation Recovery
The prior financial year posted depreciation recovery amount associated with the Fixed Asset following the completion of the Fixed Asset Event.
The closed (period) posted depreciation amount associated with the Fixed Asset following the completion of the Fixed Asset Event.
The prior closed (period) posted depreciation amount associated with the Fixed Asset following the completion of the Fixed Asset Event.
The posted exception depreciation amount associated with the Fixed Asset following the completion of the Fixed Asset Event.
The accumulated posted exception depreciation amount associated with the Fixed Asset following the completion of the Fixed Asset Event.
FixedAssetEvent Accumulated Posted Exception Depreciation Transfer
The accumulated posted exception depreciation transfer amount associated with the Fixed Asset following the completion of the Fixed Asset Event.
FixedAssetEvent Fomer Year Posted Exception Depreciation
The financial year posted exception depreciation amount associated with the Fixed Asset following the completion of the Fixed Asset Event.
The posted derogatory depreciation amount associated with the Fixed Asset following the completion of the Fixed Asset Event.
The accumulated posted derogatory depreciation amount associated with the Fixed Asset following the completion of the Fixed Asset Event.
The posted derogatory depreciation reversal amount associated with the Fixed Asset following the completion of the Fixed Asset Event.
FixedAssetEvent Accumulated Posted Derogatory Depreciation Reversal
The accumulated posted derogatory depreciation reversal amount associated with the Fixed Asset following the completion of the Fixed Asset Event.
The posted revaluation reversal amount associated with the Fixed Asset following the completion of the Fixed Asset Event.
The accumulated posted revaluation reversal amount associated with the Fixed Asset following the completion of the Fixed Asset Event.
The posted impairment transfer amount associated with the Fixed Asset following the completion of the Fixed Asset Event.
Notes associated with a Fixed Asset Event (e.g. credit control).

sect2.title: financialAccountGroup, sme:pluralName=financialAccountGroups, sme:compliance=MAY, sme:canGet=TRUE, sme:canPut=FALSE, sme:canPost=FALSE, sme:canDelete=FALSE, sme:isSyncSource=FALSE, sme:isSyncTarget=FALSE

entry.para: The Financial Account Group unique identifier.
Flag to indicate if the Financial Account Group is an ‘active’ one .
Flag to indicate if Financial Account Group is (soft) deleted.
The label for the resource to be presented in the user interface. To support application-specific or language-specific descriptions of resources.
Reference for the Financial Account Group.
Name of the Financial Account Group.
A longer description of the Financial Account Group.
Financial Accounts associated with the FinancialAccount Group.
FinancialAccounts can belong to multiple FinancialAccount Groups.
Notes associated with a Financial Account Group.

sect2.title: financialAccountJournal, sme:pluralName=financialAccountJournals, sme:compliance=SHOULD, sme:canGet=TRUE, sme:canPut=TRUE, sme:canPost=TRUE, sme:canDelete=TRUE, sme:isSyncSource=TRUE, sme:isSyncTarget=TRUE

entry.para: Flag to indicate if the FinancialAccountJournal is an ‘active’ one .
Flag to indicate if FinancialAccountJournal is (soft) deleted.
The label for the resource to be presented in the user interface. To support application-specific or language-specific descriptions of resources.
Reference associated with the Financial Account Journal.
Another reference associated with the Financial Account Journal.
The name of the FinancialAccountJournal (e.g. batch name)
A longer textual description of the FinancialAccountJournal.
Link to the OperatingCompany associated with the Financial Account Journal.
The Financial Account Journal currency (e.g. GBP, USD, EUR).
The currency as used by OperatingCompany, the business operating the Sage application (the “base” currency).
Rate used to convert from FinancialAccountJournal Currency into FinancialAccountJournal OperatingCompany Currency, if different.
FinancialAccountJournal OperatingCompany Currency Exchange Rate Operator
Operator to be used (multiplication or division) to convert from FinancialAccountJournal Currency to FinancialAccountJournal OperatingCompany Currency.

E.g. if the operator is division then it is Sales Order Values in Sales Order Currency / Sales Order Operating Company Currency Exchange Rate = Sales Order Values in Sales Order OperatingCompany currency.
FinancialAccountJournal OperatingCompany Currency Exchange Rate Date
Date of the exchange rate used to convert from FinancialAccountJournal Currency to FinancialAccountJournal OperatingCompany Currency, if different.
Sum of all credits on the Journal Lines (sum of credits should equal sum of debits).
Sum of all debits on the Journal Lines (sum of debits should equal sum of credits).
Checksum/count of lines associated with the Financial Account Journal.
A link to all the lines making up the Financial Account Journal.
The date upon which the Journal was entered.
Default to system date if not used,
The date upon which the Journal was posted (if different).
Default to system date if not used,
A link to the Fixed Asset(s) associated with the Financial Account Journal.
A link to the (depreciation) schedule associated with the Fixed Asset creating the Financial Account Journal.
Opportunities associated with the Financial Account Journal.
Sales Quotation(s) associated with the Financial Account Journal.
Sales Order(s) associated with the Financial Account Journal.
Sales Order Delivery(s) associated with the Financial Account Journal.
Sales Invoice(s) associated with the Financial Account Journal.
Sales Return(s) associated with the Financial Account Journal.
Sales Return Delivery(s) associated with the Financial Account Journal.
Sales Credit(s) associated with the Financial Account Journal.
Purchase Requisition(s) associated with the Financial Account Journal.
Purchase Order(s) associated with the Financial Account Journal.
Purchase Order Delivery(s) associated with the Financial Account Journal.
Purchase Invoice(s) associated with the Financial Account Journal.
Purchase Return(s) associated with the Financial Account Journal.
Purchase Return Delivery(s) associated with the Financial Account Journal.
Purchase Credit(s) associated with the Financial Account Journal.
Receipt(s) associated with the Financial Account Journal.
Payment(s) associated with the Financial Account Journal.
Link to the Timesheets associated with the Financial Account Journal.
Link to the Expense Claims associated with the Financial Account Journal.
Link to the Payrolls associated with the Financial Account Journal.
Link to the (Employee) Benefits associated with the Financial Account Journal.

sect2.title: financialAccountJournalLine, sme:pluralName=financialAccountJournalLines, sme:compliance=SHOULD, sme:canGet=TRUE, sme:canPut=TRUE, sme:canPost=TRUE, sme:canDelete=TRUE, sme:isSyncSource=TRUE, sme:isSyncTarget=TRUE

entry.para: The Financial Account Journal Line unique identifier.
A link to the Financial Account Journal (batch) holding these lines.
Flag to indicate if the Financial Account Journal Line is an ‘active’ one .
Flag to indicate if Financial Account Journal Line is (soft) deleted.
The label for the resource to be presented in the user interface. To support application-specific or language-specific descriptions of resources.
Reference associated with the Financial Account Journal Line.
Another reference associated with the Financial Account Journal Line.
The type of the Financial Account Journal Line
The accounting type of the Financial Account Journal Line (debit or credit)
The number of the Financial Account Journal Line (e.g. batch name)
A longer textual description of the Financial Account Journal Line.
Financial Account Journal Lineing code or ‘natural’ account.
A link to the Fixed Asset(s) associated with the Financial Account Journal Line.
A link to the (depreciation) schedule associated with the Fixed Asset creating the Financial Account Journal Line.
Opportunities associated with the Financial Account Journal Line.
Sales Quotation Line(s) associated with the Financial Account Journal Line.
Sales Order Line(s) associated with the Financial Account Journal Line.
Sales Order Delivery Line(s) associated with the Financial Account Journal Line.
Sales Invoice Line(s) associated with the Financial Account Journal Line.
Sales Return Line(s) associated with the Financial Account Journal Line.
Sales Return Delivery Line(s) associated with the Financial Account Journal Line.
Sales Credit Line(s) associated with the Financial Account Journal Line.
Purchase Requisition Line(s) associated with the Financial Account Journal Line.
Purchase Order Line(s) associated with the Financial Account Journal Line.
Purchase Order Delivery Line(s) associated with the Financial Account Journal Line.
Purchase Invoice Line(s) associated with the Financial Account Journal Line.
Purchase Return Line(s) associated with the Financial Account Journal Line.
Purchase Return Delivery Line(s) associated with the Financial Account Journal Line.
Purchase Credit Line(s) associated with the Financial Account Journal Line.
Receipt Line(s) associated with the Financial Account Journal Line.
Payment Line(s) associated with the Financial Account Journal Line.
Link to the Timesheet Line(s) associated with the Financial Account Journal Line.
Link to the Expense Claim Line(s) associated with the Financial Account Journal Line.
Link to the Payroll Line(s) associated with the Financial Account Journal Line.
Link to the (Employee) Benefits associated with the Financial Account Journal Line.
Note associated with the Financial Account Journal Line

sect2.title: lease, sme:pluralName=leases, sme:compliance=MAY, sme:canGet=TRUE, sme:canPut=TRUE, sme:canPost=TRUE, sme:canDelete=TRUE, sme:isSyncSource=TRUE, sme:isSyncTarget=TRUE

entry.para: Flag to indicate if the Lease is an ‘active’ one .
Flag to indicate if Lease is (soft) deleted.
The label for the resource to be presented in the user interface. To support application-specific or language-specific descriptions of resources.
Another reference associated with the Lease.
Link to the OperatingCompany associated with the Lease.
Textual information associated with the Lease.
Textual information associated with the Lease.
A link to the Fixed Asset(s) associated with the schedule.
The type of Lease (plan type for example).
The type of accounting used by the Lease, e.g. GAAP, IFRS, other
The type of contract associated with the Lease.
Link to the Trading Account that will be the deliverer of the Lease.
Reference for the Lease as used by the Supplier.
Reference to another document (e.g. the purchase order or purchase Invoice associated with the supplier).
The Actual/planned duration of the Lease, in duration unit.
Year associate with the Lease (where a schedule spans multiple years there will be multiple Leases)
A start date associated with the Lease(if applicable).
An end date driven by the Supplier associated with the Lease (if applicable).
The end date driven by the Operating Company associated with the Lease (if applicable).
The review date associated with the Lease (if applicable).
The nature of the contract associated with the Lease.
Link to the Financial Account Group associated with this Lease.
Financial accounting code(s) applicable to the Lease.
The currency of the Lease (e.g. GBP, USD, EUR).
The currency as used by OperatingCompany, the business operating the Sage application (the “base” currency).
Rate used to convert from Lease Currency into Lease OperatingCompany Currency, if different.
Lease OperatingCompany Currency Exchange Rate Operator
Operator to be used (multiplication or division) to convert from Lease Currency to Lease OperatingCompany Currency.

E.g. if the operator is division then it is Sales Order Values in Sales Order Currency / Sales Order Operating Company Currency Exchange Rate = Sales Order Values in Sales Order OperatingCompany currency.
Lease OperatingCompany Currency Exchange Rate Date
Date of the exchange rate used to convert from Lease Currency to Lease OperatingCompany Currency, if different.
The currency (e.g. GBP, USD, EUR) used by the Supplier Trading Account on the Lease.
Could be derived from order currency.
Lease Supplier TradingAccount Currency Exchange Rate
Rate used to convert the Lease currency into the Supplier Trading Account currency, if different.
Lease Supplier TradingAccount Currency Exchange Rate Operator
Operator to be used (multiplication or division) to convert from Lease Currency to Lease Supplier Trading Account Currency
E.g. if the operator is division then it is Lease Values in Lease Currency / Lease Supplier TradingAccount Currency Exchange Rate = Lease Values in Lease Supplier TradingAccount Currency.
Lease Supplier TradingAccount Currency Exchange Rate Date
Date of the exchange rate used to convert from Lease Currency to Supplier Trading Account Currency, if different.
Flag to indicate if this Lease is the current on.
A link to a previous Lease that this Lease is related to (e.g. for renewals, this will point to the schedule for the previous year).
Link to Child Lease associated with this Lease.
Leases can be ‘nested’ to create Lease hierarchies (e.g. a parent lease could be for a year, whereas the child lease could be for individual periods).
Link to Parent Lease associated with this Lease.
Leases can be ‘nested’ to create Lease hierarchies (e.g. a parent lease could be for a year, whereas the child lease could be for individual periods).
The initial contract value of the Lease.
The contract value of the Lease as at the start of the lease (e.g. start of year).
The current Contract value of the Lease.
The Contract value of the Lease as at the end of the lease (e.g. end of year).
The amount that will still be outstanding at the end of the lease (balloon amount or residual payment).
The Capital value outstanding on the Lease as at the start of the lease (e.g. start of year).
The current Capital value outstanding on the Lease.
The Capital value outstanding on the Lease as at the end of the lease (e.g. end of year).
Last payment made against the lease.
Date the last payment was made against the lease.
The cumulative value of all the payments made against the Lease.
Last capital payment made against the lease.
The cumulative value of the capital payments made against the Lease.
Last Finance payment made against the lease.
The cumulative value of the Finance payments made against the Lease.
The cumulative value of the depreciation amount financial expense (charge).
A link to all of the Fixed Asset Events associated with the Lease.

sect2.title: grant, sme:pluralName=grants, sme:compliance=MAY, sme:canGet=TRUE, sme:canPut=TRUE, sme:canPost=TRUE, sme:canDelete=TRUE, sme:isSyncSource=TRUE, sme:isSyncTarget=TRUE

entry.para: Flag to indicate if the Grant is an ‘active’ one .
Flag to indicate if Grant is (soft) deleted.
The label for the resource to be presented in the user interface. To support application-specific or language-specific descriptions of resources.
Another reference associated with the Grant.
Link to the OperatingCompany associated with the grant.
Textual information associated with the Grant.
Textual information associated with the Grant.
A link to the Fixed Assets associated with the Grant.
A link to all of the Fixed Asset Events associated with the Grant.
A link to the Company that provides the Grant (the Grantor).
The date the Grant was approved.
Value indicating the percentage of associated investment (Fixed Asset, Project) that is covered by the Grant.
The currency of the Grant (e.g. GBP, USD, EUR).
The currency as used by OperatingCompany, the business operating the Sage application (the “base” currency).
Rate used to convert from Grant Currency into Grant OperatingCompany Currency, if different.
Grant OperatingCompany Currency Exchange Rate Operator
Operator to be used (multiplication or division) to convert from Grant Currency to Grant OperatingCompany Currency.

E.g. if the operator is division then it is Sales Order Values in Sales Order Currency / Sales Order Operating Company Currency Exchange Rate = Sales Order Values in Sales Order OperatingCompany currency.
Grant OperatingCompany Currency Exchange Rate Date
Date of the exchange rate used to convert from Grant Currency to Grant OperatingCompany Currency, if different.
The currency (e.g. GBP, USD, EUR) used by the Company on the Grant.
Could be derived from order currency.
Rate used to convert the Grant currency into the Company currency, if different.
Grant Company Currency Exchange Rate Operator
Operator to be used (multiplication or division) to convert from Grant Currency to Grant Company Currency
E.g. if the operator is division then it is Grant Values in Grant Currency / Grant Company Currency Exchange Rate = Grant Values in Grant Company Currency.
Grant Company Currency Exchange Rate Date
Date of the exchange rate used to convert from Grant Currency to Company Currency, if different.
Some Grants may be for a fixed value. Where this is the case, this is the value associated with the Grant.
Some Grants may be drawn down in parts (or received) up to a maximum value (e.g. a facility). Where this is the case, this is the maximum possible value of the Grant.
Some Grants may be drawn down in parts (or received) up to a maximum value (e.g. a facility). Where this is the case, this is the amount of the Grant currently taken.
Some Grants may be drawn down in parts (or received) up to a maximum value (e.g. a facility). Where this is the case, this is the remaining amount of the Grant that may be taken.
The cumulative value of the depreciation amount financial expense (charge).
A link to any Project that may be associated with the Grant.
For Grants directly attributable to Projects, this is the amount of the Grant that has been allocated to the Project.
A link to any (cash) receipts associated with the Grant.
